result.markdown: --- title: "Take-home_Ex01" author: "Stefanie Felicia" date: "" date-modified: "last-modified" execute: eval: true echo: true warning: false freeze: true --- ## Background background of what I'm doing and objective of the analysis A local online media company that publishes daily content on digital platforms is planning to release an article on **demographic structures and distribution of Singapore in 2024**. Assuming the role of the graphical editor of the media company, you are tasked to prepare **at most three data visualisation** for the article. ## The Data The dataset was extracted from Singstat under the name Singapore Residents by Planning Area / Subzone, Single Year of Age and Sex, June 2024. ![](images/screenshot_dataset.png) It comprised of 6 variables and 60K records. The dataset recorded the demographics and count of residents who lived in each sub zone and planning area in June 2024. ## Load Required Libraries ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} pacman::p_load(ggrepel, tidyverse) ``` ::: ## Import Data ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} population_data <- read_csv("respopagesex2024.csv") ``` :::
